vocabulary.english: to point something out; show something (OF(DO))
to bring someone along; to include something (OF(DO))

contents.markdown: _I_- verbs are the last of the big six, so congratulations! Many focuses are possible with _i_- verbs: OF, BF, CF, IF, MF and RF. We will not cover CF, IF, MF or RF because they are much less common. Other than discussing formation and aspect, which apply to all _i_- verbs, this lesson will cover OF _i_- verbs. The next lesson will cover BF _i_- verbs.
No special nuances; just to perform an OF action.
Add _i_ before the root. Sometimes there is morphing, but unlike -_an_ and -_in_ verbs, all aspects are derived from the infinitive, so memorizing the infinitive is enough.
Insert _in_ before the second vowel of the infinitive (see _mag_- verbs for stress patterns).

Exception – If the root begins with a vowel, _h, l, r, w_ or _y_, it is more common to insert _ni_ in front of the root in the infinitive. Notice that these are the same exception letters used for -_in_ and -_an_ verbs, but for _i_- verbs, vowels and _h_ are also included.
From the infinitive, repeat the first syllable of the root then insert _in_ before the second vowel (see _mag_- verbs for stress patterns).
Add the first two syllables of the infinitive to the root (see _mag-_ verbs for stress patterns).
These are OF verbs, so as a reminder:

item.tagalog: Ibigay mo ang aso kay Maria.
Itinuro ni Jason ang lechon sa kanila.
Ilalagay ng guro ang mga mangga sa eskwelahan.
item.english: The teacher will put the mangoes in the school.

contents.markdown: If you are wondering why the _ang + sa_ phrase order is not reversed here, it is because it does not cause ambiguity. For example, natives would not interpret _Ibigay mo (ang aso kay Maria)_ as “Give (the dog with Maria)” because the sentence would be missing a recipient. So the standard order is preferred in this case.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kailan mo ibinigay ang tatlong daang piso kay Joaquin?
exampleSentences.english: When did you give the three hundred pesos to Joaquin?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Itinuturo ba niya ang eskwelahan sa kanila kapag nandito siya?
exampleSentences.english: Does she point out the school to them when she is here?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi siya hahayaang ilagay ang mga tanong sa pinto sa taong ito.
exampleSentences.english: She will not be allowed to put the questions on the door this year.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ano ang ikaapat na punong itinanim ng lalaki?
exampleSentences.english: What is the 4th tree the man planted?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Isama mo sina Jessica at Jasmine at bilhin mo ang mga sapatos.
exampleSentences.english: Take Jessica and Jasmine along and buy shoes.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ibibigay ko sa kaniya ang walong oras kung gagawin ko ito.
exampleSentences.english: I will give her the eight hours if I do it.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ito ang ikalimang beses na itinuro ko sa yun kaniya.
exampleSentences.english: This is the 5th time I pointed that out to her.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kinukuha nila ang inilagay namin sa lamesa.
exampleSentences.english: They are getting the one we put on the table.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Itatanim ng asawa ni Analyn ang puno sa basong yun.
exampleSentences.english: Analyn's husband will plant the tree in that glass.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Isinama niya ang anak niya nang siyam na segundo lang.
exampleSentences.english: She had her child accompany her for only 9 seconds.
